attraction_summary: Với kinh nghiệm tổng hợp hơn 20 năm trong ngành du thuyền hạng sang, Du thuyền Indochine được xây dựng theo tiêu chuẩn quốc tế cao nhất, đảm bảo sự thoải mái và an toàn tối ưu, sẽ mang đến trải nghiệm tuyệt vời cho du khách trên Vịnh Lan Hạ yên tĩnh.Đọc thêm
reviews: Chúng tôi dành 2 ngày 1 đêm du ngoạn quanh Vịnh Hạ Long trên du thuyền Prince. Chiếc thuyền đáng yêu với 4 cabin. Phòng của chúng tôi rất thoải mái và có vòi sen tuyệt vời. Quang hướng dẫn viên của chúng tôi có kiến ​​thức và có khiếu hài hước tuyệt vời. Phần còn lại của phi hành đoàn rất thân thiện và dịch vụ rất tuyệt vời. Thức ăn rất phong phú và cực kỳ ngon. Đầu bếp của chúng tôi đã thực hiện một số tác phẩm chạm khắc tuyệt vời từ quả dưa hấu theo hình chiếc thuyền của chúng tôi. Chúng tôi hoàn toàn giới thiệu công ty này nếu bạn quan tâm đến các chuyến du ngoạn trên Vịnh Hạ LongĐọc thêm

Chúng tôi đã ở hai đêm trên Prince 2. Đây là một bài đánh giá khó viết vì xếp hạng kém hoàn toàn là do chúng tôi rất thất vọng với tình trạng của con thuyền. Nó hoàn toàn không xa xỉ và đang rất cần một số công việc bảo trì và cải tạo. Ngoài ra, nó thật thú vị và có thể là một trải nghiệm năm sao nếu chiếc thuyền tốt hơn. Các nhân viên thật tuyệt vời, chủ nhà cũng như chủ nhà của chúng tôi và đồ ăn rất tuyệt.Đọc thêm

Thưa ông - Bà JokeBels,

Có vẻ như đã có sự nhầm lẫn khi bạn đề cập đến một tàu du lịch khác trong bài đánh giá của mình. Chúng tôi muốn làm rõ rằng chúng tôi là Cánh buồm Đông Dương chứ không phải HOÀNG TỬ 2.

Mặc dù chúng tôi rất buồn khi biết về trải nghiệm của bạn nhưng chúng tôi vui lòng yêu cầu rằng nếu bạn không ở lại với chúng tôi, vui lòng xóa đánh giá này và gửi đánh giá của bạn đến nhà cung cấp dịch vụ du lịch thích hợp.

Nếu bạn có thêm bất kỳ câu hỏi nào hoặc nếu có bất kỳ điều gì khác mà chúng tôi có thể hỗ trợ bạn, vui lòng cho chúng tôi biết.

Cho đến lúc đó, điều tốt nhất của tôi,
Đặng Hồng Dương - Mr. - Đọc thêm

Chúng tôi yêu thích 2 đêm, 3 ngày trên hành trình đến Vịnh Hàn La và Vịnh Hạ Long. Chiếc thuyền và bộ cơ sở được bổ nhiệm rất tốt và lớn. Thức ăn rất ngon, dù là buffet hay set menu tùy theo bữa ăn - có rất nhiều lựa chọn. Rượu có giá rất tốt khiến chúng tôi ngạc nhiên. Chuyến đi dọc theo vịnh rất đặc biệt: sương mù buổi sáng khiến nơi đây trở thành một cảnh quan huyền bí và một số khoảng trống vào buổi chiều để chèo thuyền kayak và đi xe đạp là nơi hoàn hảo vì không quá nóng. Đây là một phần rất thư giãn trong hành trình 3 tuần của chúng tôi tại Việt Nam và rất khuyến khích điều đó.Đọc thêm

reviews: Chúng tôi đã có chuyến du ngoạn 2 ngày 1 đêm tuyệt vời ở Vịnh Lan Hạ. Phong cảnh thật ngoạn mục và chúng tôi hoàn toàn có thể chiêm ngưỡng nó từ rất nhiều nơi xung quanh thuyền: từ nhà hàng khi chúng tôi đang dùng bữa, từ hiên tắm nắng tuyệt vời mang đến tầm nhìn 360 độ - tầm nhìn và thậm chí từ ban công phòng của chúng tôi. Chiếc thuyền tuyệt đẹp, được trang trí với rất nhiều yếu tố từ thời thuộc địa. Chúng tôi đã dành nửa giờ chỉ để khám phá những chi tiết nhỏ đó. Phòng ngủ rất thoải mái và đồ ăn rất đa dạng và ngon miệng. Nhân viên thân thiện và hữu ích. Trải nghiệm tuyệt vời, hoàn toàn xứng đáng.Đọc thêm

We were probably one of the last overnight cruises before Halong Bay was closed down due to Covid 19 so we were very lucky to have this amazing experience. Checked in at the Indochina dock and transferred by tender to the boat. First was a safety briefing by our cruise director along with a refreshing glass of ginger tea. We were then given our keys and collected our luggage.  The room was lovely but we had no towels. Mentioned it to the cruise director  - Dani -  on our way to lunch and he immediately offered us an upgrade to a room with a balcony on the 2nd deck. A beautiful room complete with rainwater shower and fresh orchids by the washbasin. A set lunch was served which was very good and then we had chance to sit outside and enjoy the stunning scenery before our excursion to The Surprise Cave. This was by tender then a climb up many steps to the entrance to the caves. Absolutely incredible and worth the climb. Back on the ship by 5.30 and and watch the carving of fruit and vegetables by one of the chefs. He was an artist, so skilful. Back to our room before Buffet Dinner served at 7.30pm.  The buffet was OK but not the best, several dishes ran out before my husband had chance to try them, these were not replenished, a couple on an adjoining  table also missed out on the chicken, seafood fried rice, stir fried vegetables etc. One would think that the caterers on board  would know which dishes are favourites and have extra  in the kitchen to replenish the dishes. By the time we were ready for desserts once again the choice remaining left a lot to be desired. This was the only negative of our cruise. Ti Chi on deck early the following morning and watching the sun rise was stunning. Tea, coffee and pastries for the early risers with a full breakfast served later in the morning was absolutely fine.Read more

We booked a trip along Ha Long Bay directly when booking the holiday, through booking.com, not through any kind of travel agent in Hanoi or Ha Long. We knew there were many different ones, my husband chose Indochina due to their reputation and even though the price was not the cheapest, I felt we got our money - s worth and enjoyed ourselves. attraction_summary: Với kinh nghiệm tổng hợp hơn 20 năm trong ngành du thuyền hạng sang, Du thuyền Indochine được xây dựng theo tiêu chuẩn quốc tế cao nhất, đảm bảo sự thoải mái và an toàn tối ưu, sẽ mang đến trải nghiệm tuyệt vời cho du khách trên Vịnh Lan Hạ yên tĩnh.Đọc thêm
reviews: Chuyến đi tuyệt vời ngay từ khi bạn bước lên thuyền và nhân viên cung cấp cho bạn khăn nóng. Chiếc thuyền tuyệt đẹp và sạch sẽ không tì vết xung quanh. Nước nóng - truyền hình cáp. Đồ ăn rất ngon và phong phú. Không có chai nhựa cũng là điều đáng khen ngợi để tránh ô nhiễm. Tất cả nhân viên đều được đào tạo bài bản và tôi - tôi rất biết ơn vì họ đã thay khăn trải giường của chúng tôi vào đêm trước sau khi con chúng tôi gặp - tai nạn - : - Các hoạt động rất vui vẻ và không hề chậm chạp - nóng nảy. Ví dụ như chuyến tham quan làng bằng xe đạp, thật thú vị - tuyệt đẹp như môn chèo thuyền Kayak của Mrng. Nhiệt độ vào tháng 12 thật tuyệt vời - lạnh lẽo - theo tiêu chuẩn Đông Nam Á. Thật tuyệt vời đối với người quản lý xuất sắc, một cựu bác sĩ chiến đấu. Rất khuyến khích. Đọc thêm

Ha Long Bay is stunning! Beautiful and captivating place. You can never get tired of sailing throughout the landscape.Overall I enjoyed Indochina Sails, the ship was clean and the staff were nice, and the food was good. I would rate them as average though. I didn - t feel like this company went above and beyond for their guests, I thought the ship and the rooms were nice and definitely clean, but dated. Food was good but not  - excellent, -  and even somewhat bland at times. Some other nicer ships we saw were Dynasty Cruises and President Cruises.Pros- Beautiful rooms! It is worth upgrading for a more spacious room with a  - balcony. - - Excellent and kind staff- Ha Long bay has  - a lot -  of government restrictions, which vastly limits what these cruise companies can do in the bay. It was worth it to stay the extra day to see more of Ha Long bay.- Happy Hour is a nice touch! Buy 1 drink, get 1 freeCons- Trip entailed two tours to Pearl Farms, that did not make sense to me. The Pearl Farm within Ha Long Bay was the better one though!- I would suggest bringing your own beer, water bottles, and snacks for the ship. You get a mini fridge! It - s small, but you still get one.- Balconies aren - t really balconies because they do not have seating. But it was nice to have the larger windows.-You will wait a long time between food. Lunch at noon and then dinner at 7. And they have no options in between for food. I wish they had an afternoon tea or snack scheduled for you.- Not much to do at night. It was too dark to see anything outside  - we went when it was cloudy at night, and the light pollution from other ships made stargazing impossible - , and very slow wifi that hardly worked  - they only turn their wifi on at night - . They had some board games but not many. They also offered Squid fishing, however, no one was there to teach us how to fish for Squid. - On the first night, one of the staff lied to my friend and said it was Happy Hour when it wasn - t, we think he intentionally tried to cheat her, because I went up to the same guy about 5 minutes after her, and he told me it was not Happy Hour yet.Read more

Thực hiện chuyến đi 2 ngày cho Du thuyền Indochine tại Vịnh Lan ha. Ban ngày, chúng tôi chèo thuyền kayak tại một trong những hang động, điều này cực kỳ thú vị. Chúng tôi đã đặt thực đơn thay vì buffet do số lượng khách trên tàu có hạn, nó rất ngon, đặc biệt là cá ngừ tartare. Ngày thứ hai, chúng tôi đi dạo ở một hang động khác và quay trở lại đất liền. Tôi sẽ không bao giờ quên trải nghiệm này và chắc chắn sẽ làm lại khi trở về Việt Nam.Đọc thêm

We did the 3 days, two night cruise of Halong Bay . We chose Indochina Sails after lots of internet research and choose the two night option so we could go deeper into the bayOverall our experience was positive with just a few areas for possible improvements.Positives:- Good communication before the trip. Answering all questions quickly - The room was spacious and the bed was comfy and the bathroom was large with a separate shower and bath- The main ship was nice and had a good deck area to relax on- there was a lot of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner cooked well and with good variety - the staff were friendly and helpful and keen to help- there we nice touches like hot towels and welcome drinks when we arrived and came back from excursions- the sights we saw were pretty with good views- not too much was packed in so plenty of time to relax and enjoy the views Areas for improvement:- The food service was at times to efficient. Lunch on both days was a set menu served to us. On both days it was very quick, with the next course arriving as soon as you finnished your last bite, not giving you any time to digest and enjoy the meal. Also, on day 2 when we were on a day boat with just  one other couple and were running ahead of schedule I think so were  served lunch at 11:45. It was far too early so we weren - t really hungry and it was again really quick. After lunch we didn - t have any more stops and just cruised for a few hours so it could have easily been served later - It felt like we could have perhaps seen more. On day 1 there was just one stop to some caves for about an 1 hour. If you were on the 1 night cruise you would just have seen this and one other island on the morning you left . We paid extra for two nights and stopped for kayaking then a trip to the fishing village. It was raining which meant less kayaking time, but even so this was over quickly and so we sailed around slowly for ages and then when back to the main boat where we had free time all afternoon . I think another island visit or two could easily have been fit it. Also, at our fishing village trip I asked a few questions to our guide about the resettlement which I was interested in. I was told to wait as he would tell us a story later over lunch. The story was never told! This was a shame .Read more

We did a 2 night 3 day cruise with Indochina sails and it was better than we could expect, our tour guide while there was Jax and he was great, extremely friendly and his service was second to none. The first day on boarding we were given a set menu lunch, the staff were very accommodating to my meat shrimp and dairy free request making separate dishes whenever necessary, next we went to surprise cave and this was good, about 150 stair climb to the mouth inside was very hot but massive and well worth the climb, Jax was very knowledgeable about history and hidden surprises throughout the cave. We got back to the boat and relaxed with cocktails and watched a fruit carving show before a delicious buffet dinner with a separate vego entree made for me. Day 2 was one of the best days I - ve had in Vietnam, we got up early for Tai chi and breakfast then got on a seperate day boat for the day. Our group was very small with only one other couple and the guides Jax and VY. We went kayaking and went to a special cave and secret beach, we were the first ones there and had the cave and the beach to ourselves while we swam and got plenty of photos, we visited a fishing village and a pearl farm before heading back to the boat to meat up with the other people that had boarded for the 1 night cruise. Jax was very informative about most things this day and filled us in with all we needed to know. VY was also lovely taking plenty of good photos of us. Back on the boat we had heaps of time to relax before a rice paper roll class and another great buffet dinner. Our last day we got up early again for Tai chi and went to ti top island to hike to the top of the 500 steps before another swim at the beach, again we got there again first so has the view to ourselves before the stampede of people we saw on our way back down the stairs. The staff were great and very helpful, special thanks again to Jax for his kind and professional service. I would recommend this cruise to anyone for the price we paid it was well worth the money spent and I would do it again in a heart beat. Read more

Ha Long bay is a must be in Vietnam, even if it is so touristy experience. We decided to go with overnight stay on boat to experience as much as possible. And the mission was accomplished however it is not worth its money. The bay is beautiful despite the pollution of the water. Floating rubbish and lack of life is nowadays bay. Despite of this one of the  - attraction -  was fishing squids, although even our guy said there are no squids there. Swimming in the bay is at your risk - forget about crystal clear snorkeling. Attractions on the boat are none. Sunrise and sunset are spoiled by the presence of plenty of other boats anchoring. staff was ok, except the barman who was very rude and greedy - they even removed the free tea and coffee so guests had to buy water at the bar  - one liter is not enough in temp of 40deg - . Alcohol price is dearer than in the West. The same experience one can have on the much cheaper day cruise.Read more

Nhân viên rất xuất sắc, được so sánh và kết hợp, họ được đối xử như hoàng gia. Thuyền đẹp và sạch sẽ, yêu thích phong cách xưa. Chuyến tham quan được tổ chức rất tốt, cảm giác như tôi đã nhìn thấy Hạ Long rất nhiều nhưng cũng có nhiều thời gian để thư giãn. Thức ăn ổn.Đọc thêm

I did my research, just as you are doing now and across the internet on a number of outlets you find reviewers speaking very highly of Indochina Sails  - enough so need mind you that the company is able to command a premium in cabin price versus the rest of the market  -  I booked on their website - . I believe there was some sort of additional value to be had by utilizing Indochina - so I booked the 1 Night Ha Long Bay cruise with the additional transfer to and from my hotel in Hanoi. But what I found, is that the premium does NOT add up - the cruise is acceptable, on an average boat, with a friendly, but lackluster crew and overall customer experience that does NOT align with their tagline  - Luxury you deserve - Transfer to Ha Long Bay- Transfers are an additional  - 15 each way; driver was right on time to pick me up and to my surprise I was the only one on the van - comfortable start!Arrival in Ha Long Bay - There is a lounge designed to house arriving and departing guests while the boat is cleaned and the departing transfers arrive. Spent about 20 minutes here mildly uncomfortable given very minimal Aircon, a ginger tea is servedCruise - Arriving on the boat, it has - antique charm. I was graciously upgraded to a room one notch higher than the Suite I had booked. It ticked all the boxes required, clean bed and bathroom; however, initial thoughts were in line with looking older than the photos on the website- Lunch was served, food was tasty but service was rushed. Throughout the trip, I found the food service staff and bartenders to be...on edge  -  not the warmest or most welcoming- After lunch, we made our way to a cave not that far by, and then ushered off the boat to tour the inside of the cavern. Klein and his colleague spoke passable English and worked to explain some historical facts. Overall, they were personable and nice  - this was the activity for the day -  - Cooking Class - - On the itinerary, it was stated we would enjoy a fruit  -  vegetable carving class...none of that ever happened. On board, they stated we would witness a  - cooking show - , we then came to find out it was a spring roll making class. Which, fine...sounds good, but involves barely any work at all and did I actually learn anything? No. It was over in 5 minutes time. Dinner - Served buffet style, selection was varied and good. I enjoyed this part! The live music was also a plus. Happy Hour - You buy one, get one free! I joined a few others for some beverages, but when ordering with the bartenders, we found that they were quite busy with watching various sitcoms on their phones or simply struggled to understand which drink  -  how many we wanted. We got there eventually, but we further got the sense of their level of English  - not a big deal, we are of course visitors in their country - Day 2 -	Before breakfast, they took us on another adventure to an island that you can hike up and then take a quick dip into the beach; it was nice! Lovely view from the top but the beach got crowded very quickly.Departure -	I did not partake in breakfast as my stomach was feeling a tad uneasy, but we made it back to the original lounge about two hours after returning from the beach-	Checking out, this is also when I found out bottled water is extra : -  -	It was roughly 45  -  60 minutes between arriving back in the hot lounge, to when the transport van was available to pick up us and begin our 2  -  hour journey back to Hanoi; if started to annoy me a bit because originally the manager said 10  -  15 minutes, but then came over later and said just 20 minutes longer  -  that is not luxury any one deserves during holiday. Overall, based on my experience and from other friends who were exploring Ha Long with other tour companies and I believe they found better values. In such a competitive market, there are newer ships and itineraries with more robust activities  - such as actual cooking  -  carving classes, and kayaking and with no additional charge - .Read more

I did an overnight cruise on Lan Ha bay with indochinaThis was the most extravagant part of my trip in vietnam by far, Private mini bus transfers form hanoi from your accommodation. The rooms are really comfortable and very luxurious.There were only 16 people on the boat and it so it was pretty empty but there was still a huge range of food of amazing quality at every meal. the food was really impressive. was slightly annoying had to wait 2 hours at the depot for the boat transfer which wasn - t until 13:15, when we had left hanoi at 08:30. Lan ha bay is definitely quieter than halong so recommend this if you are trying to escape the crowds. There is a huge upper deck, with hot of sunbeds and sofas, even a hot tub on the 3rd level!This is very expensive, im sure it is worth the money it costs, and its a lot of money for vietnam, especially as is less than 24hours actually on the boat. But i think you have to pay to get a good boat here, especially if you want a more exclusive experience and to escape crowds. Cánh buồm Đông DươngĐọc thêm

We enjoyed  our 1 night cruise which was part of a 2 week tour of Vietnam. The boat was beautifully furnished. Our cabin was a good size, and had en-suite shower room. The breakfast and buffet meals were well presented and very tasty. Staff helpful and friendly. We were able to go by tender on 2 occasions to land and walk on the small islands, including visiting caves.Tai Chi early morning was a great way to start the day.My only negatives was the volume of boats in the bay you can spot at any one time.... I counted over 60 at one point. Of a night they don - t moor to close to each other, some close, some in the distant. Whilst some boats are day cruises. It doesn - t affect your sleep. Also the amount of plastic floating in the water and whilst at night they did fishing off the boat and the boat lights highlight the diesel etc floating on the water surface. So if your expecting a idyllic remote bay its not. Which is sad because its the volume of tourists at any one time.Would we go again? Probably not, not because of the boat, staff or meals but because of the sheer number of tours boats.Read more
